body:
In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Jan 16, 2015, 14:01

No. `select` is behaving exactly as it should there. `select` selects which errors you want to see. That way if you don't want to see 1 error, you just ignore it, but if you want to focus on fixing instances of 1 error, you select it.

In GitLab by @cakoose on Jan 16, 2015, 14:53

1. Flake8 doesn't report the E901-category error even when "select = E901" (the second-to-last example in my original comment).  Should I file this as a separate bug?

2. The docs for "select" says: "select errors and warnings to enable which are off by default".  It's the "which are off by default" part that threw me off.  A better doc: "only enable the errors and warnings listed here".

3. Is there a way to tell Flake8 "enable all the standard errors and warnings, plus these few specific warnings I choose"?

In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Jan 24, 2015, 11:31

> Flake8 doesn't report the E901-category error even when "select = E901" (the second-to-last example in my original comment). Should I file this as a separate bug?

E901 is not an error code I'm aware of. Do you mean C901? If C901 is what you mean *and* C901 is what you're using, then you should be using `--max-complexity` to enable that.

> The docs for "select" says: "select errors and warnings to enable which are off by default". It's the "which are off by default" part that threw me off. A better doc: "only enable the errors and warnings listed here"

There's a list under [Default](https://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/2.2.3/config.html#default)

> Is there a way to tell Flake8 "enable all the standard errors and warnings, plus these few specific warnings I choose"?

No. There is no way to do that in pep8 so there is no way to do it in flake8 (since flake8 merely adds extension capability and a few extra defaults on top of pep8 at this point).

In GitLab by @cakoose on Jan 25, 2015, 01:32

See the first example in the bug report.  E901 is what it says for the syntax error.

Re: the docs.  What does the "which are off by default" mean?  Why shouldn't that phrase just be deleted from that sentence?

In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Jan 25, 2015, 09:12

Re the first example, here's a corresponding bug report: https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8/issues/30

> What does the "which are off by default" mean? Why shouldn't that phrase just be deleted from that sentence?

There are error codes that are ignored (a.k.a., off, not reported, etc.) by default. It is pep8's default list of ignored error codes/classes.

issue.title: Handle EPIPE IOErrors when using more than 1 job - [merged]

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Aug 16, 2015, 12:05

_Merges bug/69 -> master_

If someone is using flake8 and piping it to a command like `head`, the
command they are piping flake8's output too may close the pipe earlier
than flake8 expects. To avoid extraneous exception output being printed,
we now catch IOErrors and check their errnos to ensure they're something
we know we can ignore.

This also provides flexibility to add further errnos for ignoring on a
case-by-case basis.

Closes #69

issue.title: Proposed Flake8 3.0 - [merged]

milestone.description: Next breaking change release of Flake8 with (ideally) as few breaking changes as possible.

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @sigmavirus24 on Mar 15, 2016, 15:15

_Merges proposed/3.0 -> master_

*Description of changes*

- Rewrite flake8's internals to be independent of pep8
- Rework flake8's handling of options parsed from config files in a unified way that's better tested than pep8's handling was
- Add proper logging to flake8 to allow more informative verbose information to be shown to the user
- Internalize some of pep8's check handling and token generation

*Related to:*

- #117 
- #111 
- #106
- #105
- #100 
- #90
- Option 2 from #89
- #84 
- #74
- #69
- #66 
- #54
- #21
- #14

And more that I'll update this with later

---

*Note that this is a merge in from https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8-engine which still has some open issues which will be fixed in this branch.*
